title: US urged to see opportunity in China’s economic woes, and align policies accordingly
description: Attracting capital and production from China should take priority over tariffs and other hardline measures, according to an American economist.

title: China spy agency widens remit as well as reach with WeChat social media account
description: State security ministry’s recent assertiveness on the platform has included commentary on China-US relations.

title: Europe’s hardball tactics on trade put China in a bind
description: The EU is increasingly acting against what it sees as unfair Chinese trade practices by taking measures to curb Chinese exports and investments. Mired in multiple challenges of its own, a frustrated Beijing may be forced to concede more to Europe’s demand for a level playing field.

title: ‘Substantive’ talks between US, Chinese militaries must resume, Pentagon official says
description: China’s ‘risky’ moves in Taiwan Strait and South China Sea could spiral into crisis, though conflict isn’t ‘imminent or inevitable’, says assistant US defence secretary.

title: Chinese billionaires’ bid to trim art collection ends in disappointment at Sotheby’s Hong Kong auction
description: Liu Yiqian and Wang Wei managed to only sell 28 of the 39 paintings on offer for a total of HK$455 million (US$58.1 million) 24 per cent less than the bottom estimate.

title: Chinese rock festival organisers complain they are being ‘smeared’ with ‘exaggerated’ complaints about thefts
description: Organisers of the four-day event in Nanyang city in Henan admit thieves targeted some festival goers, but downplay the scale of the problem.

title: China and the West should cooperate as world faces ‘interlocking crisis’, UN official says
description: Public health is one area with ‘incredible opportunities’ for collaboration, according to Siddharth Chatterjee, the United Nations’ top representative in China.

title: As China’s Capvision probe ends, foreign investors remain skittish
description: Capvision, a US-based corporate research and consultancy firm, has come out of several months of rectification able to continue its business. But multinationals are still waiting for the all-clear to continue their operations without looking over their shoulders.

title: Tech war: Taiwan’s share in global semiconductor manufacturing supply chain to decline, while mainland China poised for gains, IDC report says
description: Changes loom for the global chip manufacturing supply chain, as Taiwan and mainland China grapple with geopolitical tensions and the semiconductor policies of various governments.

title: Scientists from China, Europe to target gamma-rays from Tiangong space station
description: The multi-country Polar-2 mission aims to learn more about the most powerful cosmic explosions since the Big Bang.

title: China’s Wang Yi pushes Himalayan neighbours on ‘territorial integrity’ at forum near disputed border with India
description: Top Chinese diplomat stresses environment and infrastructure as he hosts diplomats in Tibet city near contested area of Arunachal Pradesh, which has been at centre of tensions between Beijing and New Delhi.

title: Chinese scientists create low-carbon building materials inspired by worms
description: Team looked to the underwater structures built by sandcastle worms, which secrete a glue that binds together sand and shell pieces.

title: China says it warns another Philippine supply operation near Second Thomas Shoal; Manila claims successful operation
description: Manila’s National Security Council declares successful delivery of provisions to its forces at the Second Thomas Shoal.

title: Taiwan to probe suppliers helping Huawei build chip plants under the radar across southern China
description: Taiwan’s minister of economic affairs said she would look into whether the firms are conducting their businesses in China within the scope of approved activity.

title: Australia concluded China decoupling ‘impossible’ after series of classified studies
description: Three separate studies managed by three Australian administrations all came to the same conclusion: the trade relationship with China cannot be practically decoupled or diversified.

title: China planning to offer more space for foreign equipment on future Chang’e 8 moon mission
description: The 2028 mission could carry up to 200kg of equipment from other countries, more than 10 times the payload carried on next year’s Chang’e 6 mission.

title: Will China’s property headaches have broader economic effects?
description: As China takes more steps to deleverage and cool down its property market, the protracted slump is having an effect on overall economic growth – projections are being cut, with real estate mentioned as a specific cause for the revisions.
